intro: Cyphia dentata, commonly known as the toothed cyphia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with serrated edges and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Cyphia dentata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
